encounters.reason: Fall and subsequent loss of consciousness

encounters.findings: Hemorrhagic stroke identified in the right hemisphere

tests.name: Coagulation profile
tests.result: INR elevated, suggesting prolonged bleeding time

ward_round_notes.note: Patient experienced a fall last night, now with decreased level of consciousness. GCS recorded at 11. Slurring of speech noted.

CT scan confirms hemorrhagic stroke. Starting mannitol for cerebral edema. Neurological examination: right-sided weakness, continued slurred speech, GCS 11. Patient not safe for discharge, requires close monitoring.
No significant improvement in neurological status. GCS remains at 11. Patient shows signs of agitation and confusion. Safety measures in place to prevent further falls.
Patient's condition remains critical. Persistent slurred speech and right-sided weakness. Discussion with family about prognosis and ongoing care needs. Patient not safe for discharge.
